text: Sergey Trishin (born Moscow, 12 December 1984) is a Russian rugby union player. He plays as a centre. He played for VVA Saracens and currently plays for Enisei-STM, in the Rugby Premier League. He has 56 caps for Russia, since 2005, with 5 tries scored, 25 points on aggregate. He had his debut at the 52-12 win over the Czech Republic, at 12 November 2005, in Krasnodar, for the Six Nations B. He was called for the 2011 Rugby World Cup, playing in a single game and without scoring. He had his most recent cap at the 32-27 loss to Japan, at 24 November 2018, in Gloucester, England, in a friendly game.Sergey Trishin International Statistics ==References== ==External links== *Sergey Trishin International Statistics Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Russian rugby union players Category:Russia international rugby union players Category:Rugby union centres Category:VVA Saracens players Category:Sportspeople from Moscow
title: Sergey Trishin
